definition[0]: a type of soft rubber with a lot of air in it, used in furniture
definition[1]: a mass of very small bubbles on the surface of a liquid
example[1]: The sea was covered in foam.
definition[2]: a substance which is like a very thick soft liquid with a lot of bubbles in it
example[2]: Firefighters using water and foam are still tackling the blaze.
example[4]: The green water splashed and foamed over the rocks.
